question:
On a recent holiday you lost avaluable item. Fortunately, you have travel insurance to cover the cost of anything lost.
Write a letter to the manager of your insurance company. In your letter:
-describe the item you lost
-explain how you lost it
-tell the insurance company what you would like them to do.
text: I am writing this letter to make a claim on my travel insurance.  My membership number is AB987234.

I recently lost my Apple Watch during my holiday in Hawaii.  It was a birthday gift that was given by my husband last December. I've used it for only a few months.  Its watch face is black and the colour of the band is pink.  My family and I travelled to Hawaii from 22nd February to 28th February 2022.  We were staying at the Mariott Hotel for 6days.  I was about to go swimming at the hotel where I stayed, and because there was no safe-deposit box around, I put it on a table that was settled by the pool.  When I returned from swimming, I realised it was gone and couldn't find it anywhere.
I believe I am entitled to claim the value of my Apple Watch.  I hope one of your staff will be able to call me to assist me in making a claim for the aforementioned item
I look forward to hearing from you at the earliest possible. Thank you in advance.
